H0.text: What is the brightest star in our celestial sphere. Canopus

H1.text: What is the brightest star in our celestial sphere. Alpha Centauri

H2.text: What is the brightest star in our celestial sphere. Vega

H3.text: What is the brightest star in our celestial sphere. Sirus

A4.text: Sirius is the brightest star in the night sky

A5.text: Sirius is almost twice as bright as Canopus, the next brightest star

A6.text: Sirius will continue to be the brightest star as seen from Earth (other than the Sun) for the next 210,000 years.

A7.text: Alpha Centauri is the third-brightest star in the nightéº‚, outshone by only Sirius and Canopus.
